alert.note: Alert for Boyle; Casey; Lincoln; Marion; Taylor; Washington (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:26PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN LINCOLN...SOUTHEASTERN MARION...NORTHEASTERN TAYLOR...SOUTHERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN BOYLE AND NORTHWESTERN CASEY COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Lebanon, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Bradfordsville, Peytons Store, Forkland, Jacktown, Poplar Corner, Merrimac, Aliceton, Atterson, Ellisburg and Gravel Switch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Boyle; Casey; Lincoln; Marion; Taylor; Washington
